website_summaries.verdict: Sling Media's Slingbox M2 is identical to the previous-version place-shifting box in almost every way, with a higher price tag justified by the fact that the Slingplayer apps are now free.
pros: Physically and technically identical to the excellent Slingbox M1
cons: $50 more than the Slingbox M1, which is still available and is the same hardware

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. Live 7 months in Florida and 5 months up north. Have to pay Comcast in Florida year round for service. Have high speed internet up north with rabbit ears for local TV but no cable. Installed Slingbox in Florida and stream Florida TV up north to our iPads then AirPlay to 60" HDTV. Have had a couple of iNet issues but the Slingbox came back in a few hours. Works for me !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product had been used and activated before!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in January 2017. Just got to hook it up, and it would not activate. Found out it had to be reset, as already used once before!! The product quick start was missing also. This was a sealed box I just opened tonight, April, 2018. After a hard reset, was able to set it up, but obviously according to Sling, was a used item. What a fraud on Amazon's supplier...probably take this off before it can be read. Also, the warranty information on Sling showed the warranty started several months before I even received mine...
customer_reviews.author: sagetek

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, NO HDMI?!?!  Frustrating to buy new (old) calbes I threw out years ago as obsolete!
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of the product. Using it to help my bro living in Hong Kong to get some US TV. No HDMI?!?! Had to go out and buy some component cables and wrestle with my now not 100% digital setup. Frustrating!!! BTW the ad supported app is not that big of a deal. No ads in full screen and for $15 you can get rid of the ads permanently. I get how long-time users were used to getting all this for free, but it is not as terrible as some make it seem.
customer_reviews.author: LearningMonkey

customer_reviews.title: used for a good 5 months
customer_reviews.text: used for a good 5 months. all of sudden no longer able to connect and sling box contact support is HORRIBLE. like absolutely HORRIBLE. they are telling me at 3pm there time that there is no supervisor able to help. also telling me that my contract ended and its only 90 day support. would have been nice to know but they don't even tell you. they won't even entertain you. all they want you to do is pay there fee to get someone to assist you. was very excited about this purchase and came highly recommended and now i wouldn't recommend to the world.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Don't know what I did without it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Slingbox. I have 2 of the M2 and one 350, all still in service. Picture quality is much better with the M2 and it will connect via wireless or Ethernet cable. I travel a lot and rely on the Slingbox so that I can watch my own cable tv from home when I am away. I really can't imagine being without this.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: works very well most of the time
customer_reviews.text: I use the Slingbox to watch TV on my computer devices and my TV's that don't have cable, but do have Apple TV or Chromecast. It works very well most of the time, but you definitely need to be patient with it because sometimes it simply doesn't work. re-booting and re-trying usually fixes the situation, but the app is a bit finicky. the box seems pretty solid, but I do give it a hard boot once very few months.
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Lo

customer_reviews.title: Works good so far
customer_reviews.text: I've read the negative reviews. I had a different experience. I downloaded the app for smartphone, tablet, and Fire Stick. The interfaces are a little different. so far they all work fine. I've used it on my smartphone via 4G, and it worked great. I'll be trying it on my trip to London, and I'll report back. But so far the Slingbox works very good.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I bought...$100.00 down the drain.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for viewing at a vacation home during the off season. Was able to get video feed...couldn't change channels. I should have returned right then. Continued to try and get it to work. No go. Finally contacted the company... they were very nice but told me my 90 day warranty period was over. I would have to request a remote on a public forum web site...total nonsense.. wish I never purchased. $100.00 Down the drain. Buyer beware. They won't support the product after 90 days..
customer_reviews.author: Devildog

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility issues with Google Chromecast
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Fire TV stick but terrible with all versions of Google Chromecast. Constantly drops signal and gives connectivity errors when trying to watch with Google Chromecast, I thought the issue was with the very first Chromecast from years ago but then I bought the new Chromecast 4k and has the same exact issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mr_Saturn

customer_reviews.title: Not working with Chromecast at all
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit specifically because I wanted to watch my TV at house A on my tv at house B using my phone and my chromecast. Well 3 different chromecasts, 2 different android phones and there is still no chromecast icon in the Slingplayer app. Called tech support and I'm not even sure the tech really knew what a chromecast was. I'm going to give them one more chance and call again but I'm considering sending this back. The unit itself is nice and works well but the company is selling it based on features that don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Want ads? Buy this streaming device... LAME!
customer_reviews.text: The streaming on this box is decent but I wanted to review it because I paid good money for this device and they FORCE you to see ads on their cheesy software client. Could not believe it when it loaded. If you don't like advertising don't buy this device.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K. Nash

customer_reviews.title: One cable subscription, wherever I go...
customer_reviews.text: Been slinging my cable from home to Portland all week and it works very well. Integration with apple TV could be improved (when streaming from device to Apple TV response time of controls is very slow. But works very well directly on device. The ability to access my DVR remotely is terrifically useful. (I thiink Sling should remove the short ads that stream when you first start up the free version of the app — but I guess its a small price to pay (and I believe you can upgrade to the paid app and remove the ads). Overall - this is just the device I need to keep up with my TV when I'm out of town!
customer_reviews.author: Rtrout

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without this!
customer_reviews.text: This is so important to me, for keeping up w our crazy weather when I’m traveling. No matter where I am, I can watch my LOCAL news & weather for latest updates. Whether I’m 4 hours or 24 hours away from home, this is my driving lifeline. I even keep my cable box (instead of going ALL streaming) to be able to use this. I don’t know if they still make this particular model, but any model has to be this great.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: Sling M2
customer_reviews.text: Slingbox M2 works ok. I already had a Slingbox 500 which is HDMI, so better quality video, but Sling stopped supporting it for Mac OS Catalina. I got bad info that the older M2 would work. It doesn’t. So complete disappointment! Sling is focusing on Sling TV.
customer_reviews.author: mmusgrovetn

customer_reviews.title: Very good!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two so when we are on vacation, I can watch my Bloomberg and my gf can watch her day time drama. The setup is easy for one decoder, and not so easy for the other one. In the end, a 'hard reset' took care of the issue. You do need to have a fairly good background in setting up electronics. When it is working, it is all good. Amazing product. 5* for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Gino

customer_reviews.title: A bit difficult to set-up
customer_reviews.text: Whew! A bit difficult to set-up and I was never able to contact live support. The Slingplayer's instructional set-up video completely skipped over mentioning that I would need to purchase an additional cable for my cable box to tv via HDMI. Luckily, I'm stubborn and YouTube searched a specific process for setting-up my Directv's genie mini box. Thank You Douglas for posting!! Seems to work okay now, but still a few minor glitches here and there. Next week I'm going on an intr'l trip and will really put Slingbox to the test. Wish me luck!
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Don’t leave home without it!
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I use it mostly on my iPad when I’m traveling overseas (I’m a heavy traveler). I’ve used this one or its predecessor in some strange places. I’ve watched the Super Bowl in both Laos and Cambodia. I’ve been very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: An American in Paris

customer_reviews.title: Barely adequate for slinging TiVo
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised with my Tivo mini and Fire TV. My setup did require using TiVo breakout cables for component video and audio. Cons: Poor WAF (wife acceptance factor) with Roku because it requires using a smart phone or tablet to control. Remote commands have a lag that was almost a deal-breaker, i.e. - there is a 1-2 second delay after pressing the button before the command is executed. The player app is not available for my Vizio Smart TV nor for PS4. Pro: It will sling Tivo streaming apps which was unexpected.
customer_reviews.author: TonyP3rd

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect solution for someone that travels a lot
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This is a perfect solution for someone that travels a lot, especially internationally. All the lame OTT video solutions available to subscribe to block access outside the US. So, if you want English programming and to be able to watch US news, sports, etc., your only option is to figure out a way to watch your home cable TV while traveling. Slingbox does that. It can be a bit complicated to set up if you do not know much about routers and IP addresses, but with some patience you should be able to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Great product but be wary of connecting via wireless
customer_reviews.text: Only had this a week and not happy at all with the consistency of the connection when I am trying to connect to my slingbox from outside the home. It locked out all day yesterday and had to unplug it when I got home to restart it. Useless for the day. UPDATE: Gave up on connecting the slingbox on my network via wireless and connected it via ethernet connection and it has made a world of difference. Starts every time and connection has been great.
customer_reviews.author: brian dolan

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. This is the second one I have. You can see anything you have on your TV or recorded on your recorded. You can also start recordeing from your set top box from your I-phone. Comes in handy when you are away from your house and realize you are missing that important game or you forgot to record a show you like to watch. No monthly charges.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer support

customer_reviews.author: R Burdett

customer_reviews.title: NFL TICKET
customer_reviews.text: If you have a strong signal its crystal clear. Beautiful resolution. But If you don't have a strong signal where your sing box is hooked up at there will be interruptions in your connection with the cable. Frames freezing up, blurry screen, sing box app shutting off on its own and you have to restart it. Resolution bad. Stuff like that... But all in all. It works. It does what it says and it works. Which is pretty awesome! Plus I'm happy. Because now I can spend Sunday's with my Man watching NFL Ticket and he doesn't have to go home. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Paradiseseeker

customer_reviews.title: Works with Moxi whole-house DVR
customer_reviews.text: No offense to the folks who responded to my question about whether the M2 would allow me to control my 6-tuner Moxi with the standard, "check with Slingbox" answer. I was looking for a practical, substantive answer from someone who has done it. The practical answer is, Yes - it works and works well (even over a 4G network, albeit with occasional intermittent lags). The setup recognized my Moxi device and gave me full remote control. Although the Android tablet version of Slingplayer has a full featured remote, the Android smartphone version has rudimentary remote functions. I can see all my channels & recordings and even schedule recordings via remote phone, tablet or Roku.

customer_reviews.title: The Slingbox M2 uses component cables not HDMI
customer_reviews.text: It uses as input 2x COMPONENT CABLES NOT HDMI, in other words, It needs to be connected to 12 RCA type cables at the back (see picture attached). The Sligbox M2 box from Sling Media contains only 6 RCA cables. So I hope you have your cable/satellite connected by old skewl Component Cables or you wont be able to use it out of the box. Oh and it works really well and it is very easy to setup no errors at all. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Web Browser Requires Flash
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old Slingbox Pro user and with my DVR, I wanted to add a new Slingbox to my TIVO. Installation/setup was very easy. So what's the problem? Slingbox requires a web browser that uses FLASH. Edge and Chrome no longer support Flash and you will need to use an older version of IE or Firefox to use access your Sling. With Flash being a security issue, sooner or later, it will be removed from all web browsers and you may have a $150.00 brick. That said, you can always keep an old browser around and use your M2, but mine is back in the box and going back.

customer_reviews.title: Works great -temporarily.  Previous Slingbox stopped working after less than 3 years
customer_reviews.text: works well but hard to give a product that stopped working after less than 3 years more than 3 stars. Belkin now makes a similar product (see other reviews) that may be worth checking out. Belkin usually makes well designed durable products. In addition, the apps for Belkin's equivalent product are free, including for Apple products. Slingbox charges $5 per Apple device which can add up. It appears that the main drawback to Belkin's product is that it is not as easy to set up. Since I already had a Slingbox, I purchased a Slingbox replacement.

product_meta.title: Slingbox M2
product_meta.description: Watch and control 100% of your cable or Satellite channels you already pay for, live or recorded, on your tablet, phone, or laptop, anywhere you have an Internet connection with no monthly fees or blocked shows. All of your live and recorded movies, sports, or TV shows anywhere, anytime with unlimited free apps for iOS, Android, Windows, and Amazon Fire HD. Design that delivers High availability, scalability, and for maximum flexibility and price/performance. Manufactured in Mexico .
feature_bullets: Watch and control 100% of the TV you already pay for on a tablet, phone, PC, or Mac with unlimited free apps
Watch on a second TV anywhere via Apple TV, Chromecast, Fire TV, or Roku. Also view and manage DVR recordings
Connect via WiFi or Ethernet, component and composite in/out.
